channel.title: Israel jails man for 'holy semen' sex abuse
channel.description:
http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/8644637.stm
'"He would give these people different explanations: among others, that a holy scent comes from him, and that his semen is a holy fluid, which by contact could heal body and soul," the statement said.'
JewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJewJew

item.title: Israel jails man for 'holy semen' sex abuse
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

atheists have no need to prove anyone wrong, its up to you to prove your ideas right.

The burden of proof is on he who puts forward any postulate.

After all, I could say there is a very small teapot orbiting the sun between Jupiter and Saturn, since you can’t disprove me you’re forced to accept the teapot is real and should pray to it 5 times a day.

An archangel re-dictates parts of the old and new testament to an illiterate Arab businessman in the 7th century?
Totally believable.

Read full topic
item.source: Israel jails man for 'holy semen' sex abuse

item.title: Israel jails man for 'holy semen' sex abuse
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:5, topic:338427”]We have a criteria for what is believable and what isn’t. If someone comes to us with a message that he claims is from the creator, that message can be tested.

If someone claims his semen is holly, that is an obvious troll. Religion has taught us to differentiate between right and wrong.

On the other hand, atheists are going to have a hard time proving this man wrong.[/quote]

It’s no more more or less obvious bullshit than everything else in religion.

Read full topic

item.title: Israel jails man for 'holy semen' sex abuse
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:4, topic:338427”]Okay but where is your evidence against these claims?

You religious people are laughing at the Jews for believing ridiculous claims without realising that this is how the rest of the world sees you.[/quote]

We have a criteria for what is believable and what isn’t. If someone comes to us with a message that he claims is from the creator, that message can be tested.

If someone claims his semen is holly, that is an obvious troll. Religion has taught us to differentiate between right and wrong.

On the other hand, atheists are going to have a hard time proving this man wrong.
